title: `inverse_transform_add`: Align to dav1d EOB convention
body: The prior segmentation fault in `rav1e_idct_8x16_internal_16bpc_sse4` revealed that we were calling the assembly functions with EOB values off by one. So amend the shared calling functions to align with the convention in dav1d. The rav1e convention admits a zero EOB value when all coefficients are zero. In this case, transforms are a no-op and we may can stay in range when subtracting one otherwise. We may safely revert #3067 with this adjustment in place. Fixes #3066.

title: x86: Disable 8x16 16bpc inverse transforms for SSE4.1
body: This avoids a segmentation fault specifically in `rav1e_idct_8x16_internal_16bpc_sse4`, a minimal fix for #3066.

title: CI: Fix up deploy workflow
body:
* Finish fixing up deploy script (artifact names)
* Fix up archive names in deploy script
* Deploy Windows-msvc-generic rav1e.exe

title: CI: Correct format of target_cpu for x86_64 in deploy workflow
body: Confusingly, the LLVM target-cpu format is not the same as in the target triple.

title: Add level to API and CLI.
body:
This validates MaxPicSize, MaxHSize, MaxVSize, and MaxDisplayRate.

MaxHeaderRate, Main/HighMbps, Main/HighCR, MaxTiles, and
MaxTileCols are not currently checked.

title: Bump actions/cache from 2 to 3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [actions/cache](https://github.com/actions/cache) from 2 to 3.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/cache's releases.

v3.0.0

  • This change adds a minimum runner version(node12 -> node16), which can break users using an out-of-date/fork of the runner. This would be most commonly affecting users on GHES 3.3 or before, as those runners do not support node16 actions and they can use actions from github.com via github connect or manually copying the repo to their GHES instance.

  • Few dependencies and cache action usage examples have also been updated.

v2.1.7

Support 10GB cache upload using the latest version 1.0.8 of @actions/cache

v2.1.6

  • Catch unhandled "bad file descriptor" errors that sometimes occurs when the cache server returns non-successful response (actions/cache#596)

v2.1.5

  • Fix permissions error seen when extracting caches with GNU tar that were previously created using BSD tar (actions/cache#527)

v2.1.4

  • Make caching more verbose #650
  • Use GNU tar on macOS if available #701

v2.1.3

  • Upgrades @actions/core to v1.2.6 for CVE-2020-15228. This action was not using the affected methods.
  • Fix error handling in uploadChunk where 400-level errors were not being detected and handled correctly

v2.1.2

  • Adds input to limit the chunk upload size, useful for self-hosted runners with slower upload speeds
  • No-op when executing on GHES

v2.1.1

  • Update @actions/cache package to v1.0.2 which allows cache action to use posix format when taring files.

v2.1.0

  • Replaces the http-client with the Azure Storage SDK for NodeJS when downloading cache content from Azure. This should help improve download performance and reliability as the SDK downloads files in 4 MB chunks, which can be parallelized and retried independently
  • Display download progress and speed
Changelog

Sourced from actions/cache's changelog.

Releases

3.0.0

  • Updated minimum runner version support from node 12 -> node 16

3.0.1

  • Added support for caching from GHES 3.5.
  • Fixed download issue for files > 2GB during restore.

3.0.2

  • Added support for dynamic cache size cap on GHES.

3.0.3

  • Fixed avoiding empty cache save when no files are available for caching. (issue)

3.0.4

  • Fixed tar creation error while trying to create tar with path as ~/ home folder on ubuntu-latest. (issue)

3.0.5

  • Removed error handling by consuming actions/cache 3.0 toolkit, Now cache server error handling will be done by toolkit. (PR)

3.0.6

  • Fixed #809 - zstd -d: no such file or directory error
  • Fixed #833 - cache doesn't work with github workspace directory

3.0.7

  • Fixed #810 - download stuck issue. A new timeout is introduced in the download process to abort the download if it gets stuck and doesn't finish within an hour.

3.0.8

  • Fix zstd not working for windows on gnu tar in issues #888 and #891.
  • Allowing users to provide a custom timeout as input for aborting download of a cache segment using an environment variable SEGMENT_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_MINS. Default is 60 minutes.

3.0.9

  • Enhanced the warning message for cache unavailablity in case of GHES.

3.0.10

  • Fix a bug with sorting inputs.
  • Update definition for restore-keys in README.md

3.0.11

  • Update toolkit version to 3.0.5 to include @actions/core@^1.10.0
  • Update @actions/cache to use updated saveState and setOutput functions from @actions/core@^1.10.0
Commits
  • 9b0c1fc Merge pull request #956 from actions/pdotl-version-bump
  • 18103f6 Fix licensed status error
  • 3e383cd Update RELEASES
  • 43428ea toolkit versioon update and version bump for cache
  • 1c73980 3.0.11
  • a3f5edc Merge pull request #950 from rentziass/rentziass/update-actions-core
  • 831ee69 Update licenses
  • b9c8bfe Update @​actions/core to 1.10.0
  • 0f20846 Merge pull request #946 from actions/Phantsure-patch-2
  • 862fc14 Update README.md
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=actions/cache&package-manager=github_actions&previous-version=2&new-version=3)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

Release notes

Sourced from actions/download-artifact's releases.

v3.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update default runtime to node16 (actions/download-artifact#134)
  • Update package-lock.json file version to 2 (actions/download-artifact#136)

Breaking Changes

With the update to Node 16, all scripts will now be run with Node 16 rather than Node 12.

  • Improved output & logging
  • Fixed issue where downloading all artifacts could cause display percentages to be over 100%

v2.0.7 download-artifact

v2.0.6

Update actions/core NPM package that is used internally

v2.0.5

  • Add Third Party License Information

v2.0.4

  • Use the latest version of the @actions/artifact NPM package

v2.0.3

  • Misc improvements

v2.0.2

  • Support for tilde expansion

v2.0.1

  • Download path output
  • Improved logging

title: tests: Add three-pass encode with target bitrate
body: This was previously uncovered when this feature regressed during CLI rework for a library upgrade.

title: Add Dependabot configuration for GitHub Actions updates
body:
Add a Dependabot configuration that checks once a week if the GitHub Actions are still using the latest version. If not, it opens a PR to update them.

It will actually open very few PRs, since we only have major versions specified (like v3), so only on a major v4 release it will update and open a PR.

See [Keeping your actions up to date with Dependabot](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/working-with-dependabot/keeping-your-actions-up-to-date-with-dependabot).

title: Produced optimized binary versions from CI
body: There is up to a 10% performance improvement from compiling with `target-cpu=native`. We can provide the majority of this benefit to users of the pre-compiled binaries by providing avx2-optimized binaries which will be better autovectorized than the generic binaries.

title: Replace last 16x4 and 4x16 avx2 hbd satd intrinsics with asm
body: 16x4 for 10 bit is ~4x faster than the old intrinsics version.

title: Add SIMD helpers to speed up Rust get_sad
body:
The Rust version of get_sad is still used during ME for regions that are not of an exact block size.
This was consuming about 2.3% of runtime at speed 2.

This change causes the function to iterate over chunks of 4 that can easily be vectorized,
and then only the remainder will go through the slower non-vectorized SAD process.

After the change, the time spend in Rust get_sad
appears to be reduced by about 2/3, and the overall runtime of a speed 2 is decreased by about 1% on an AVX2 CPU.

title: Add AVX2 HBD SATD asm for 8x8-transformed blocks
body:
A little more than 2x faster for 8x8 block size than the current intrinsics code. Relative speedup should be higher for larger block sizes because of lower looping overhead and using a vertical sum for each 8x8 satd, and using 1 horizontal sum at the end instead of doing a horizontal sum for each block, which is much slower.

Might be possible to go faster by recursively splitting each transform into 2 smaller transforms (like a radix-2 FFT), but I figured this is good enough for now.

title: Cleanup actions
body: actions-rs seems to be not maintained, so I'm replacing it with maintained actions, I couldn't find a published replacement for the clippy action yet, but [this fork](https://github.com/actions-rs-plus/clippy-check) seems the most promising.

title: segmentation: Reset `min_segment` on data update
body:
Without this it is possible to reach an inconsistent state where `min_segment > max_segment` if for example:
* Rate control drives toward `base_q_idx = 1` resulting in `min_segment == max_segment`
* At the next keyframe, `max_segment` decreases as fewer segments are selected while `min_segment` is unchanged.

This was missed in #2986.

title: rate: Estimate target quantizer on first pass
Replace AVX2 HBD SATD intrinsics with ASM, for some block sizes
body:
I'm still working on writing ASM for 8x8-transformed block sizes (which would probably give a much bigger speedup than this PR), but I thought I might as well submit a PR for the 4x4-transformed block sizes that are currently used (16x4 and 4x16 seem unused for satd). This code should be significantly better than what the compiler generates, as the current intrinsics only explicitly vectorize the difference part and summing up the absolute value of the coefficients, while this ASM code also explicitly vectorizes the actual transform part in a much better way than the compiler.

12-bit requires 32-bit intermediate precision for the coefficients while 10-bit only needs 16-bit. Not sure if satd for 10/12 bit should actually be separate functions, so I just followed what seemed to be the convention, which is to add a `bdmax` argument to the function to determine which code path to use.

title: Remove arrayref dependency
body:
Should slightly reduce compile times and dependency fetching.

meant to push this to my own fork... had a disk failure, git files got corrupted, recloned and pushed to 'origin' which used to be set to my own fork... sorry about that 😅 (for clarification, I mean, I still meant to open this PR, I just pushed my local changes to the wrong remote repository)

title: Fix new clippy lints
body:
One instance of https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#needless_borrow

Many instances of https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#bool_to_int_with_if

title: Move v_frame to its own repository
body: Moved to https://github.com/rust-av/v_frame

title: Add scales and segment thresholds to `dump_lookahead_data`
body:
Useful to plot scale data for presentations.
i.e. https://mlug-au.org/doku.php#talks
https://mlug-au.org/lib/exe/fetch.php?media=rav1e_2022.pdf

title: Fix UB in pred_max test
body: Fixes #3029

title: bin: Admit more than 2 encoder passes
body:
Triple-pass can be implemented with the somewhat awkward: 
```sh
rav1e --first-pass pass.1 -b NNN -o /dev/null seq.y4m
rav1e --second-pass pass.1 --first-pass pass.2 -b NNN -o /dev/null seq.y4m
rav1e --second-pass pass.2 -b NNN -o seq.ivf seq.y4m
```

title: Create new speed level 8, drop level 7
body:
Level 7 was too close to 6 and 8 in speed and efficiency. There was a small but significant gap from 6 to 8. So move the old level 8 up to 7. By lowering lookahead frames for level 8 as in speed 9 and disabling loop restoration filters as in speed 10, create a new level closer to 9. Trade the additional speed this implies for speed 9 with efficiency by searching for smaller blocks.
    
AWCY results for [objective-1-fast at speed 9](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=cargo-lock-p20220913_s9_38-188%402022-09-20T10%3A04%3A15.094Z&job=speed-level-9c%402022-09-21T14%3A09%3A36.363Z), +2.53% encoding time:
|  PSNR Y |  PSNR Cb |  PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |     SSIM |  MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |     VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |     ---: |     ---: |      ---: |     ---: |     ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |     ---: |     ---: |
| -9.1313 | -13.9385 | -10.5595 |   -8.5697 | -10.2273 | -10.9573 |   -11.6210 |    -14.5064 |    -10.5500 | -11.4848 | -13.1015 | -12.1792 |


Before:
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/220594/191448930-4ca99101-8aab-45c0-aeb9-c194d7a78955.png)

After:
![v0_5_1_vs_p20220913](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/220594/191594248-635a4f16-f285-46da-998e-ebc7c979f945.png)

title: Keep the version line compatible with 0.5
body: It would trip scripts parsing the version line otherwise.

title: Add back shorthand for `--verbose` and `--quiet`
body: This shorthand flag appears to have been dropped in #2962, the removal of which broke some scripts.

title: bin: Bring `--photon-noise` out from under unstable feature
body: Align the field name with the flag and the `av1-grain` API. This feature is external to `librav1e` and used only in binaries.

title: CI: Deploy rav1e-ch binary tuned for modern x86_64
body: This yields about a 6% speed-up in preliminary tests.

title: build: Handle absent `CARGO_CFG_TARGET_FEATURE`
body:
This fixes a panic in build.rs on some aarch64 environments:
* Alpine Linux 3.16 (aarch64)
* Ubuntu 20.04 (aarch64)

title: Calculate per-plane scales in Q14 and center `log(base_q)`
body:
The move to `DistortionScale` reduces `compute_distortion()` CPU time by about 10%.

AWCY results on [objective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-8c260d2cd928fe3945ae41fa738b8e994fa5c68e&job=segment-opt%402022-09-06T05%3A03%3A46.038Z):
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |   SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |   ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 0.0902 | -0.7627 | -0.4605 |   -0.0608 | 0.0927 |  0.0987 |     0.1329 |     -0.8583 |     -0.4014 |   0.1068 | 0.1648 |   0.1460 |

title: Bump several dependencies
body: Including `image`, `pretty_assertions`, and `av1-grain`. Not touching `arbitrary` and `libfuzzer-sys` in this patch because of breaking changes I don't feel like dealing with right now.

title: Remove duplicated constants
body:
These are defined as `pub const` in another module,
which is already used in this module, so it makes sense
to remove the duplication.

title: Remove `aq_strength` configuration
body: It no longer has any effect, after reworking segmentation.

title: logexp: Correct integer part in `blog32_q11`
body:
Lost in translation, an off-by-one occurred.

AWCY results for [objective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-fe7d0f0eb0ecaa9b863a7ce5c49c0ead611f7d96&job=segment-opt%402022-09-02T06%3A32%3A25.834Z):
|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |   SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |   ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| -0.4350 | -0.2492 |  0.2750 |   -0.1279 | 0.2865 |  0.3318 |    -0.3281 |     -0.3041 |      0.1465 |  -0.3910 | -0.2546 |  -0.2703 |

Compared to the commit [before `blog32_q11` was first used](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-c113c00353e605612a41c8dbca124aca3ce2a5dc&job=segment-opt%402022-09-02T06%3A32%3A25.834Z):
|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |   SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |   ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| -0.0134 |  0.0815 | -0.0374 |   -0.0127 | 0.0153 |  0.0473 |     0.0047 |      0.0482 |     -0.0307 |   0.0040 | -0.1190 |  -0.0999 |

title: logexp: Correct rounding bias in `blog32_q11`
body:
Rounding for Q10 was accounted for in the final coefficient.

Only 2 changes in AWCY results for [objective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-59b21f9cd4dfb4c0911cd7329cb0f21d54cff52f&job=segment-opt%402022-09-02T02%3A01%3A13.103Z):
|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |   SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |   ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| -0.0012 | -0.0097 | -0.0160 |   -0.0027 | 0.0021 |  0.0014 |    -0.0012 |     -0.0138 |     -0.0110 |  -0.0015 | 0.0017 |   0.0007 |

title: Fix new lints from Rust nightly
body:
Fixes instances of lints for:
- `unstable_name_collisions` (due to addition of unstable `ilog` method)
- `clippy::partialeq_to_none`
- `clippy::needless_borrow`

title: Replace binary log in `segmentation_optimize` with a polynomial approximation in Q11
body:
Adapted from `oc_blog32_q10()` in libtheora with blessing from @tterribe.

AWCY results on [ojective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-c113c00353e605612a41c8dbca124aca3ce2a5dc&job=segment-opt%402022-08-29T16%3A32%3A54.536Z):
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 0.4305 |  0.3834 | -0.2535 |    0.1353 | -0.2666 | -0.2792 |     0.3404 |      0.4239 |     -0.1232 |   0.4060 | 0.1488 |   0.1788 |

title: Eliminate floating-point paths from `segmentation_optimize()`
body:
Extract binary logarithm and exponentiation into `util::logexp` module:
* logexp: Add 64-bit binary exponentiation and logarithm in Q57.
* logexp: Add tests for `bexp64` and `blog64`
* logexp: Add conversions between 64-bit Q57 and 32-bit Q24.
* logexp: Add binary exponential in Q24 format, saturated to 47 bits.
* logexp: Add assertion for q57 input range
* rate: Pivot to `util::logexp` functions

Extend the `util::logexp` module and use it to improve `segmentation_optimize()`:
* logexp: Rewrite `blog64` so that it is `const`
* logexp: Add a fixed-point binary log in Q24 for u32 to i32
* segmentation: Avoid reallocation in `collect::<Box<[_]>>()`

title: Clean up k-means implementation
body:
* Remove `#[allow(unused)]` now that segmentation uses k-means.
* Rename `centroids` to `means` - shorter and more general.
* Rename `N` to `K` - so that there are `K` means. Wow!
* Use references in update-means iteration - reduces `kmeans` code size by 5.5%.
* Split k-independent inner loop into its own function.
  - Reduces code size of the k-means implementation by 28%.
  - Hot instructions are concentrated in a shared block which is only 5.1% of total k-means code bytes.

The overall code size reduction for `kmeans` is 32%.

title: segmentation: Change precision of `log(scale)` to Q23
body:
This is aligned to IEEE 754 `binary32` precision and avoids possible saturation of `i32` from extreme values of `DistortionScale`.
Also, restore internal documentation from the draft of #2993.

title: Remove vergen and use built to provide the same information
body:
`built` provides similar information.

See #886

title: Updating QUALITY_&_SPEED_FEATURES document in regards to libaom
body:
This is a simple update job on the quality and speedfeatures in regards to libaom(aomenc).

Simple enough.

title: Compute segmentation map thresholds from the offsets
body:
AWCY results for [objective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-3c05349095b4cdf1887c03f615c904799abe7ea3&job=segment-map%402022-08-19T06%3A01%3A31.082Z):

|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |   SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |   ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| -1.0439 | -1.2423 | -1.2902 |   -0.3670 | 0.9061 |  0.8534 |    -0.4362 |     -0.9269 |     -1.0861 |  -0.4454 | -0.6953 |  -0.7345 |

Includes reworking of `DistortionScale` construction so that constants may be defined from rational numbers.

title: Adjust chroma offsets for frame-mean spatiotemporal scale
body:
This removes a long-standing implicit boost of chroma quality for `tune=Psychovisual`. Which looks a lot like stealing chroma bits to boost luma, so it is instructive to compare against a baseline of `tune=Psnr`.

[master-537b1b91-psnr -> master-537b1b91-psy](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-537b1b91-psnr%402022-08-17T13%3A24%3A15.386Z&job=master-537b1b91b861210062b1cf105a5bd0243bab0b90):
| PSNR Y |  PSNR Cb |  PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |     SSIM |  MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |     ---: |     ---: |      ---: |     ---: |     ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 4.0327 | -13.3105 | -13.5377 |   -7.3436 | -11.4949 | -12.0294 |    -0.6906 |    -16.1168 |    -16.4373 |  -1.1119 | 2.9790 |   3.4978 |

[master-537b1b91-psnr -> steal-chroma-bits-psy](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-537b1b91-psnr%402022-08-17T13%3A24%3A15.386Z&job=steal-chroma-bits%402022-08-17T13%3A23%3A46.996Z):
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |     SSIM |  MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |     ---: |     ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 1.9375 | -0.5029 | -1.2879 |   -5.4012 | -13.2846 | -13.7977 |    -2.7330 |     -3.4827 |     -4.4729 |  -2.5604 | 1.1417 |   1.5887 |

Note how the PSNR-HVS differences are more consistent between planes.

[master-537b1b91-psy -> steal-chroma-bits-psy](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-537b1b91b861210062b1cf105a5bd0243bab0b90&job=steal-chroma-bits%402022-08-17T13%3A23%3A46.996Z):
|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| -1.9474 | 14.9974 | 14.2232 |    2.2253 | -1.9988 | -1.9685 |    -2.0192 |     15.1318 |     14.1927 |  -1.3939 | -1.7462 |  -1.8068 |

title: Add T.35 metadata C API.
body:
This is a copy-based API, assuming that the T.35 metadata will
be small. In fact, it does one extra copy internally that could
probably be eliminated with some work.

It allows for multiple T.35 metadata messages to be added to a
frame, but no method to inspect or remove them (for references
or reconstructed frames, for example).

title: Use fixed-sized array in luma/chroma pred mode counts
body: According to #2236, this was converted to an ArrayVec since at that time Rust did not support deriving `Debug` for fixed-sized arrays above 32 elements, but this is no longer the case and thus ArrayVec is not needed.

title: CI: Pull in dev packages from Ubuntu Kinetic
body:
At present, this installs the following versions:
```
libaom3 3.4.0-1
libaom-dev 3.4.0-1
libdav1d6 1.0.0-2
libdav1d-dev 1.0.0-2
nasm 2.15.05-1
```

title: Implement `SegmentationLevel::Full` again
body:
This feature was inadvertently removed when `select_segment()` was
rewritten in #2933.

AWCY results on [obective-1-fast at speed level 0](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=issue-2985-s0%402022-08-12T22%3A43%3A41.354Z&job=segmentation-level-full-s0%402022-08-13T00%3A38%3A05.050Z):

|  PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|    ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| -4.9622 |  0.0513 | -0.5654 |   -2.1766 | -1.2898 | -1.0981 |    -4.0175 |      2.4461 |      1.4434 |  -3.8521 | -4.8615 |  -4.7457 |

Encoding time relative to `SegmentationLevel::Simple` was 262%.

title: segmentation: Limit minimum segment to avoid lossless mode
body:
It is possible for inter frames to have lower base_q_idx than intra when temporal complexity is low, due to rate control.
Find and restrict to the maximum valid segment. Fixes #2985.

title: Clean up encode_partition_topdown()
body: Removes some unnecessary copies and usages of ArrayVec.

title: CI: Fix `clippy::derive_partial_eq_without_eq`, etc. warnings
body: Seems reasonable for a simple enum.

title: Fix aarch64 satd compilation on gcc
body: gcc doesn't support arrangement specifiers after the instruction mnemonic like clang does, so they instead need to be specified after each register.

title: Use frame-relative spatiotemporal scores
body:
This should enhance the effectiveness of dynamic segmentation by normalizing the scales.

AWCY results for [objective-fast-1 at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-0bee40b875b694fe5cb85d65a309dbdd9edaa423&job=rate-control-frame-mean-rebased%402022-08-09T17%3A02%3A49.994Z)
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 2.1192 |  0.0424 | -0.4626 |    0.2634 | -1.9722 | -1.9259 |     0.6551 |     -1.4601 |     -1.9457 |   0.6588 | 1.2593 |   1.3857 |

title: Remove always-true if statement in encode_partition_topdown()
body: `must_split` is always false in this branch, because if it was true, the previous branch would have been taken.

title: Add enhanced version info
body:
This readds the git commit hash to git builds, readds the profile name, and adds a "-MODIFIED" tag to builds made with a dirty git checkout.

This also introduces a long version text, accessible by typing out `--version`, which provides additional info on the compiled binary.

Example short info for release version:
```
rav1e 0.5.0 (Release)
```

Example short info for git version:
```
rav1e p20220802-4-ge9371bb (Release)
```

Example long info for git version:
```
rav1e p20220802-4-ge9371bb (Release)
rustc 1.64.0-nightly (62b272d25 2022-07-21) x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
Optimizations: adx,aes,avx,avx2,bmi1,bmi2,cmpxchg16b,f16c,fma,fxsr,llvm14-builtins-abi,lzcnt,movbe,pclmulqdq,popcnt,rdrand,rdseed,sha,sse,sse2,sse3,sse4.1,sse4.2,sse4a,ssse3,xsave,xsavec,xsaveopt,xsaves
Assembly: Enabled
Threading: Enabled
Unstable Features: Disabled
Compiler Flags: -Ctarget-cpu=native
Built Thu, 04 Aug 2022 18:17:24 +0000
```

title: Improve badges in README
body:
- Remove `travis` badge
- Simplify badges

title: CI: Switch to codecov
body: This PR switches the CI to [codecov](https://about.codecov.io/) because it seems to offer more info about code coverage than `coveralls`

title: CI: Do not consider crates directory for code coverage
body: This PR does not consider `crates` directory for code coverage computation

title: Stabilize the --film-grain-table parameter
body:
The grain table spec does not require denoising, and is consistent across all three major AV1 encoders. I believe it makes sense to stabilize this while the grain synth denoising is being worked out. This also keeps the old name `--photon-noise-table` for compatibility, but since grain tables are not specific to photon noise, the canonical name is changed to `--film-grain-table`.

Using a grain table already requires being a somewhat advanced user, given that it requires an external tool to generate one (or writing one by hand), so there is less risk of beginners accidentally stumbling upon it and having it not do what they expect.

title: Retune constants for ssim_boost
body:
There are two target properties:
* When `svar == dvar`, `ssim_boost ~= k / cbrt(svar)`
* The constant `k` is chosen such that `mean(log(ssim_boost)) ~= 0`

The value of `k` derived from subset3 was very near `cbrt(2)`.

AWCY results for [objective-1-fast at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-cd256770a3b718d595f3112a4f217ac3af0b50d1&job=ssim-boost-icbrt-2%402022-08-05T15%3A01%3A26.384Z):
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |    VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |    ---: |     ---: |
| 0.0814 |  1.3359 |  1.4880 |    0.3151 | -0.6091 | -0.6798 |    -0.1721 |      1.2087 |      1.4406 |  -0.0515 | -0.0085 |   0.0551 |

AWCY results for [subset1 at default speed](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-cd256770-subset1%402022-08-01T15%3A07%3A50.012Z&job=ssim-boost-icbrt-2-subset1%402022-08-05T15%3A01%3A45.804Z):
| PSNR Y | PSNR Cb | PSNR Cr | CIEDE2000 |    SSIM | MS-SSIM | PSNR-HVS Y | PSNR-HVS Cb | PSNR-HVS Cr | PSNR-HVS |   VMAF | VMAF-NEG |
|   ---: |    ---: |    ---: |      ---: |    ---: |    ---: |       ---: |        ---: |        ---: |     ---: |   ---: |     ---: |
| 1.2789 |     N/A |  0.9796 |    0.5621 | -1.2553 | -0.8473 |     0.2066 |         N/A |         N/A |   0.2358 | 1.5926 |   1.5765 |

title: Add aarch64 NEON 8-bit SATD assembly for 4x4-transformed block sizes
body: This PR only adds assembly for block sizes that use a 4x4 transform for now.

title: Update deploy script
body:
- Move `rav1e-ch` build in another job to speed up deployment
- Remove useless linker options for Windows, enabled by default in `GithHub Actions`

title: Clean up CI
body:
This PR cleans up rav1e's CIs:

- Remove unmaintained `gitlab` CI
- Remove unused `.travis` CI
- Remove `if` construct to skip CI, since it is now implemented inside [GitHub Actions](https://github.blog/changelog/2021-02-08-github-actions-skip-pull-request-and-push-workflows-with-skip-ci/)
- Update `checkout` action to v3
- `macos-11` is now the `latest` version

title: CI: Improve Windows toolchains
body:
This PR improves Windows toolchains:

- Remove bugged aarch64 target not to waste CI time
- Remove linker options because they are now default in GitHub Actions

Closes #2721

title: Add T.35 metadata support.
body:
This currently only adds a Rust API. Note that this is a breaking
change as it extends the publicly visible "params" struct.

The T.35 metadata support in AV1 is very flexible - this is
intended in particular for T.35 metadata attached to frames,
in the style of the AV1 HDR10+ metadata specification:

https://aomediacodec.github.io/av1-hdr10plus/

title: Optimize `BlockSize::from_width_and_height_opt`
body:
This should slightly reduce the overhead of calling ASM functions, since many of them are dispatched via block size and thus `BlockSize::from_width_and_height_opt` is called.

Comparison of generated assembly: https://godbolt.org/z/ja5c4zr6K

title: Use external crate for grain table generation and parsing
body: In order to facilitate sharing of the grain table parsing code between crates in the AV1-Rust community, the code has been moved to a new crate called [`av1-grain`](https://github.com/rust-av/av1-grain).

title: Optimize and add test for write_uleb128 function
body:
Reduces the number of loops needed to encode the uleb128 bytes. Small global performance improvements (less than 1%).

I had to write this function for another crate anyway, so I figured it was worth porting here.

title: Use release-no-lto profile for gnu deploy on Windows
body: This PR fixes Windows `gnu` deployment enabling the new `release-no-lto` profile

title: Add a release-nolto profile
body: Workaround for #2960, because of rust-lang/rust#98302

title: Rewrite argument parsing to use Clap's derives
body:
This is something that has been on the radar for a while, but the recent
deprecation of everything from Clap 3.1 in Clap 3.2 has pushed our hand
a bit to get it done now with the new best practices from Clap 3.2.

title: Bump console + dav1d-sys + system-deps
body:
- console version = "0.15" 
 - dav1d-sys version = "0.5.0"
 - system-deps version = "6"

title: Tile rework
body: This is some initial rework to remove the spurious Arc:make_mut()

title: Avoid taking ownership of Arc<Frame<T>> in scenechange API
body: The current use of taking ownership of the passed in `Arc<Frame<T>>` in the scenechange module becomes problematic when trying to pass in a struct wrapped in `ManuallyDrop`, as it attempts to run the destructor and you can't coerce a `ManuallyDrop<Arc<Frame<T>>>` into an `Arc<Frame<T>>` that doesn't run the destructor.

title: Reuse plane allocations in estimate_intra_costs
body: As far as I understand, this frame buffer can be reused and is only read after written to, so the initial contents of the buffer should not matter.

title: Reuse me stats for lookahead
body:
This partially addresses the comments in #2934 by removing the
unnecessary field `coded_data.lookahead_me_stats`. This data is never
modified between the time it is created in
`compute_lookahead_motion_vectors` and the time it is used in
`compute_block_importances`, so there is no need to keep a separate copy
of it. Instead, we can use the main copy of the data in
`fs.frame_me_stats`.

Results in ~1% peak memory usage reduction.

title: Merge estimate_motion and motion_estimation into one function
body:
They do very similar things but with slight tweaks, so it makes sense
for them to be one function instead of two to reduce code duplication
and remove naming confusion.

[AWCY](https://beta.arewecompressedyet.com/?job=master-295ad2e385366fe0f0a42957509275f43e941bf2&job=estimate-motion%402022-05-31T07%3A30%3A27.070Z) confirmed no change in output.

title: x86: Fix relocations in `sad_plane`
body: Should fix any linker failures that have been happening recently due to relocations in `sad_plane`.

title: Bump versions of aom and dav1d in CI
body:
Builds were failing, so this became necessary.

Also deletes the .travis folder, which was unused.

title: fix-up: x86: Add bpc suffix to mc functions
body:
Function names for `avg` were accidentally swapped with `w_avg`.
There should only have been a suffix change. Fixes #2951.

title: Integrate new dav1d assembly (1.0.0)
body:
Comparing cherry-picked changes with the full log of `0.9.2..1.0.0`:
* Missing changes to `tables.c` from previous integrations are included.
* The addition of `splat_mv` assembly is excluded.
* Changes to Rust macros to support partial rename of inverse transform functions.

<details>

```diff
+fix-up: x86: Add put/prep_bilin_scaled AVX2 asm
+Support distinct 10 and 12 bit inverse transform implementations
 x86: Optimize shifts in 8-bit wiener_filter asm
 Simplify sgr_x_by_x calculations
 x86: Add high bitdepth mc(t)_scaled AVX2 asm
 x86: Remove the option to disable AVX-512
 x86: Add mc put_bilin AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add mc 8-tap AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add warp_affine_8x8 AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add blend AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add inverse transforms AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add ipred dc/h/v/paeth/smooth/pal_pred AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add ipred_filter AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add wiener_filter AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add sgr AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
 x86: Add deblock loop filters AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
-x86: Add splat_mv AVX-512 (Ice Lake) asm
```

title: v_frame: Disable missing const fn clippy lint
Replace abs() as unsigned with dedicated alternative.
body: This is an upcoming clippy lint. unsigned_abs() was added in Rust 1.51.0, meeting the current version requirement. This avoids a potential panic in debug mode. cargo test passed and sample bitstreams are identical.

title: Ignore some directories for code coverage analysis
body: This PR ignores asm for code coverage analysis

title: Reimplement sad_row as sad_plane
body: This should remove any overhead of Rust having to loop through each row and call the ASM implementation of sad_row, and instead allow a new sad_plane function to iterate over the rows by itself.

title: Remove explicit VEX coding from sad ASM
body: I didn't initially see this problem in #2940. I believe executing VEX-encoded instructions on processors that don't support them (e.g., if it only supports sse2) will cause SIGILL.

title: Rewrite x86 SAD row intrinsics in ASM
body:
This speeds up the sad_row functions mainly by avoiding a residual loop altogether, and avoiding mixing 128 bit and 256 bit vector instructions which causes slow downs on some CPUs. Instead of using a scalar residual loop to clean up the elements that don't fit into the SIMD register and unroll size, this code always uses vector instructions and just reads past the end of the array and masks out the irrelevant bytes (similar to glibc's AVX2 memchr implementation).

This also actually ends up de-duplicating some code between the SSE2 and AVX2 versions of the code, since a single macro is now used to generate both versions of the function.

Maybe in the future this function could just operate over 2 entire planes instead of just a row, this way there would be less looping overhead between rows (sad_row is only used on each row of an entire plane to get the SAD between 2 planes).

title: Split `write_coeffs_lv_map` into smaller functions
body:
This should make profiling and optimization easier, as well as improve
the code readability.

title: Remove unused lifetime.
body: This lifetime is unused in this impl. This is a fix for an upcoming clippy lint.

title: Do not consider some directories for coverage
body: This PR shouldn't consider the `target` directory anymore for coverage
